cvrfdoc.document_title: Red Hat Security Advisory: python-XStatic-jQuery224 security update
cvrfdoc.document_distribution: Copyright Â© 2021 Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

full_product_name.product_name: python-XStatic-jQuery224-0:2.2.4.1-3.el8ost as a component of Red Hat OpenStack Platform 16.1

notes.note: jquery: Passing HTML containing <option> elements to manipulation methods could result in untrusted code execution

reference.description: bz#1850004: CVE-2020-11023 jquery: Passing HTML containing <option> elements to manipulation methods could result in untrusted code execution

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes
described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

note:
An update for python-XStatic-jQuery224 is now available for Red Hat
OpenStack Platform 16.1 (Train).
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact
of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which
gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from
the CVE link(s) in the References section.

python-XStatic-jQuery is the jQuery javascript library packaged for Python's setuptools
Security Fix(es):
* Passing HTML containing <option> elements to manipulation methods could
result in untrusted code execution (CVE-2020-11023)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS
score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE
page listed in the References section.
